174.article_body: A day after 15 people fell ill after consuming contaminated water in Gazipur village of Punjab's Zirakpur, 115 more cases of diarrhoea were reported from the area. The Health Department reached the village and organised a medical camp. Officials said a team conducted door-to-door surveys and samples were also collected. The Zirakpur civic body supplied water tankers to the village.

175.title: 3 foreign nationals held for cheating prospective kidney donors in B'luru
175.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested three foreign nationals, including two people from Nigeria and one from Ghana, for allegedly cheating prospective kidney donors. The accused created fake websites of various city hospitals and lured kidney donors for transplants with advertisements offering up to ₹4 crore, police said. They were arrested following a complaint by medical director of Sagar Hospitals.

176.title: Punjab DGP launches web portal to report cyber crimes
176.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra launched a one interface multifunctional web portal for the citizens to immediately report all kinds of cyber crimes and frauds. The web portal, cybercrime.punjabpolice.gov.in, was launched on Monday. Besides lodging all kinds of cyber crimes and cyber financial frauds, the user can also track the status of their complaint using this portal, Bhawra said.

177.title: First genome sequencing lab in western UP to come up in Greater Noida
177.article_body: The first genome sequencing laboratory in western UP will likely begin its operation by May 10 at the Government Institute of Medical Sciences (GIMS) in Kasna, Greater Noida. "We will initially be able to test about 50 samples on a daily basis," GIMS director said. As of now, samples are sent to Delhi or Lucknow for genome sequencing.

178.title: Ex-eBay exec pleads guilty to harassing US couple critical of eBay
178.article_body: James Baugh, eBay's former senior director of safety and security, has pleaded guilty to harassing a US couple, who ran a website critical of eBay, by arranging anonymous messages on Twitter and sending home deliveries that included a bloody pig mask and live insects. Baugh has pleaded guilty to nine counts including conspiracy, stalking through interstate travel and witness tampering.

179.title: 2 Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists held with ammunition in J&K's Baramulla
179.article_body: Two terrorists associated with Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) were arrested with arms and ammunition in J&K's Baramulla, the Indian Army said on Tuesday. They were apprehended in a joint operation led by Baramulla Police, 29 Rashtriya Rifles and Central Reserve Police Force. "The army...recovered two Chinese pistols, two pistol magazines, ten ammunition pistols and two Chinese grenades," the army said.

180.title: New parking lot at Pune airport likely to open by July
180.article_body: The newly built multi-storeyed parking lot at Lohegaon airport in Pune is likely to be made available for public use from July 2022. "The four-storeyed parking lot is built by the Airports Authority of India (AAI) near the airport entry gate," said Santosh Dhoke, Pune airport director. Notably, multilevel car parking is part of Pune airport's expansion project.

181.title: Kim Jong-un vows to develop N Korea's nuclear forces ‘at maximum speed’
181.article_body: In a speech during a military parade on Monday night, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un vowed to bolster his nuclear forces at "maximum speed" and threatened to use them if provoked, state media reported on Tuesday. The parade to mark the armed forces' founding anniversary featured North Korea's largest known intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Hwasong-17, and other weapons.

182.title: Will resign after meeting my father: RJD MLA Tej Pratap Yadav
182.article_body: RJD MLA from Bihar's Hasanpur Tej Pratap Yadav on Monday tweeted that he will submit his resignation soon after meeting his father and party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav. The MLA, however, did not clarify if he'll be resigning from party membership, his post or both. "I followed my father's footsteps and gave respect to all the party workers," Tej said.

183.title: Don't know which direction Twitter will go: CEO Parag to employees over Musk takeover
183.article_body: On being asked about Elon Musk's plans for Twitter following a $44-billion takeover, CEO Parag Agrawal told his employees, "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go." "When we've an opportunity to speak with Elon...it's a question we should address with him," he added on being asked whether ex-US President Donald Trump would be allowed to return.

184.title: Governor is nothing but a postman: Tamil Nadu CM on anti-NEET Bill row
184.article_body: Commenting on the row over the anti-NEET Bill, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that the Governor of the state RN Ravi is "nothing but a postman". "We're not asking the Governor for approval for the Bill...Governor does not have the authority to do so," he added. "What we ask is, send the Bill to the President," Stalin further said.

185.title: SC dismisses plea seeking judicial inquiry into recent communal clashes in states
185.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed a PIL seeking judicial inquiry into incidents of communal violence during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti celebrations in some states. The petitioner had contended that the situation is alarming and only a one-sided investigation was underway. "Do not ask for such reliefs which can't be granted by the court," the SC said.

186.title: Aamir wishes students appearing for board exams, says 'Re chachu, All is well'
186.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan shared a note on his social media handle and wished the students who'll soon be giving their board exams. The note read, "Best of luck to all students who'll soon be giving their exams! Give...your best, and leave the rest...and remember...Re chachu, All is well!" On the professional front, he'll be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

187.title: Arshdeep, Rabada have been great for us: Mayank after win vs CSK
187.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal praised Arshdeep Singh and Kagiso Rabada after their 11-run win against CSK, stating that the pacers have been great for them in the ongoing IPL season. "Arshdeep bowled exceedingly well...Even Rabada bowled well, to get Ruturaj and Rayudu at that stage," said Mayank. Arshdeep and Rabada both conceded 23 runs each in their four overs.

188.title: Glitch in school bus engine causes fire in Thane, 16 children rescued
188.article_body: A school bus caught fire in Thane on Monday. 16 students had narrow escape after the bus caught fire at 1:50 pm. Thane Traffic Police rescued the children and doused the fire. Police said that a glitch in the engine of the bus led to fire. The Regional Disaster Management Cell said fire was doused in 15 to 20 minutes.

189.title: Andhra Pradesh tops in curbing malaria, gets national award
189.article_body: Andhra Pradesh has emerged as the best-performing state in terms of curbing malaria and was awarded for it by the Union Health Ministry on the occasion of World Malaria Day on Monday. The state is said to have reduced malaria cases by over five times in three years - from 6,040 cases in 2018 to 1,139 in 2021.

190.title: Woman gangraped, murdered by men who offered her lift, body thrown in well in Raj
190.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped and murdered by men who offered to drop her in their car while she was going to her in-laws' house in Dausa district of Rajasthan, police said. The main accused in the case has been arrested, police added. The body of the woman was dumped in a dry well.

191.title: Abandoned baby boy found on railway tracks in Andhra Pradesh
191.article_body: An abandoned baby boy was found on the railway tracks of Vizianagaram district in Andhra Pradesh on Monday, the police said. "A person saw the baby on the railway tracks in a bag," BS Rao, Kothavalasa Circle Inspector, said. "We have handed over the baby to the Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)," the police said.

192.title: Elon Musk's old Twitter chat on 'buying Twitter' goes viral
192.article_body: After Twitter accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company, an old Twitter chat between Musk and a Business Insider host has gone viral. In 2017, Musk tweeted, "I love Twitter," to which the host replied, "You should buy it then." Responding to the host, Musk had tweeted, "How much is it?"

193.title: HC to hear plea against lifetime minister status to ex-Goa CM
193.article_body: The Bombay High Court has agreed to hear a plea challenging the lifetime Cabinet minister status accorded to former Goa CM Pratapsingh Rane. Rane was bestowed the status in January ahead of the Assembly elections in the state. "The Constitution does not provide for conferring Cabinet [minister] status on any individual other than a current minister," argued a lawyer.

194.title: EV startup Fisker CEO removes Twitter account after Musk's $44-bn deal
194.article_body: US EV startup Fisker CEO Henrik Fisker's Twitter account has ceased to exist after Elon Musk's $44-biilion Twitter deal announcement. Fisker said in a tweet Monday that his followers should look for him on Instagram for future updates, without giving away any additional details. Fisker, who worked with Tesla earlier, was sued by Tesla claiming he stole confidential information.

195.title: 4 of family killed, 8 injured in road accident in Andhra's Tirupati
195.article_body: At least four members of a family were killed and eight others were injured in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati around midnight on Sunday, officials said on Monday. The accident took place when the mini-van which victims were travelling in collided with a lorry. "Three of them died on the spot...another girl died while being shifted to hospital," Tirupati district collector said.

196.title: I don't believe in term 'pan-India films', what does that even mean: Abhishek
196.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that he doesn't believe in the term 'pan-India films'. "What does that even mean? Do we use this for any other industry? Not at all," he added. "We are a large cinema-going population and we love our cinema. It has never mattered which language it has been made in," Abhishek further said.

197.title: Could've continued as sellable leading man but didn't want to take stress: Anil
197.article_body: Speaking about portraying elder characters in films, actor Anil Kapoor said, "Everybody said I could have waited for 8-10 years more to take a transition. For 6-7 years more I could've continued as the so-called sellable kind of leading man." "I said, 'I don't want to go through this stress now...let...the younger leading [men] take over those responsibilities'," he added.

198.title: Reduce production of sugar, focus on ethanol: Gadkari to Maha's mill owners
198.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged the sugar mill owners of Maharashtra's Solapur to reduce the production of sugar and increase the production of ethanol amid rising concerns over surplus sugarcane production. If the production goes on like this, then farmers would have no option other than suicide, he added. India's sugar exports surged by 64.9% in the financial year 2021-22.

199.title: We're not getting good starts, that's where we're lacking: Jadeja
199.article_body: After CSK suffered their sixth defeat in eight games in IPL 2022, captain Ravindra Jadeja said they're lacking in getting good starts in the first six overs of the games. "We did not execute our plans very well [against PBKS]. He [Rayudu] was batting brilliantly...but if we could've restricted them to under 175, it would've been good," he added.

200.title: 5 held during drive against stunt biking in Lucknow, 12 two-wheelers seized
200.article_body: Police on Monday seized 12 two-wheelers and arrested five persons from different parts of Lucknow city, as part of a drive against stunt biking and dangerous driving in public places, police said. Raids are on to arrest more stunt bikers who risk the lives of others and cause inconvenience to morning walkers, police added.

201.title: Man kills woman, her parents after she refused love proposal in UP
201.article_body: A man was arrested after he along with some assailants allegedly murdered a woman and her parents by slitting their throats in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Monday, police said. The incident occurred as the arrested accused wanted to have a love affair with the woman, but she refused, Gorakhpur SSP said. A shovel was used in the incident, police added.

202.title: Shop owner, son kill drunk man for eating samosa without permission in MP
202.article_body: A 40-year-old man was killed after he allegedly walked into a shop in a drunken state and ate a samosa without the owner's permission in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The owner scolded him and then hit him on the head with a stick, an officer said. The shop owner and his 20-year-old son have been arrested for murder.

203.title: Arjun's next film with Mudassar Aziz titled 'Meri Patni Ka Remake': Report
203.article_body: Arjun Kapoor's forthcoming comedy film with director Mudassar Aziz is reportedly titled 'Meri Patni Ka Remake'. "The title blends well with the world that Mudassar is trying to create in his comic caper," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. "The script has scope of two female leads and...talks are on with two actresses to play the parts," the source added.

204.title: Those teaching Hindutva were hiding during Babri demolition: Uddhav
204.article_body: Speaking on the ongoing Azaan and Hanuman Chalisa controversy, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that those teaching him Hindutva were hiding in a "rat hole" when Babri Masjid was demolished. The decision on construction of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya was not taken by the BJP government but it was Supreme Court that paved the way for the same, he added.

205.title: Beijing to test 20 million for COVID-19 amid rising cases
205.article_body: Beijing on Tuesday launched mass COVID-19 testing for about 20 million residents amid rising virus cases. People in the Chinese capital have resorted to panic buying, stocking up food and supplies as fears grow that Beijing may be placed under a strict lockdown like Shanghai. Most of Shanghai's 25 million residents have been under lockdown for more than two weeks.

206.title: 7 workers injured in blast at power plant's boiler tube in Telangana
206.article_body: Seven workers were injured in a blast at a power plant in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally. The condition of three workers is stated to be critical. As per initial information, the explosion took place at a boiler tube in the 500 MW power generation unit due to heat. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot, following which the blaze was doused.

207.title: I'll faint if I get Aamir, Urmila's response on 'Mangta Hai Kya': Palak Tiwari
207.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari said that she would faint if she gets actor Aamir Khan and actress Urmila Matondkar's response on her and actor Aditya Seal's new song 'Mangta hai Kya'. Aditya said if that happens, he would have checked all boxes from his checklist. The song is a new version of the song from Aamir and Urmila's movie 'Rangeela'.

208.title: Trump held in contempt for not giving business documents for probe
208.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has been held in contempt of court by a New York judge for not handing over business-related documents for a probe. Judge Arthur Engoron imposed a fine of $10,000 per day on Trump until he submits the documents. Authorities are investigating if his company, The Trump Organization, misreported values of assets to get loans.

209.title: India reports 1,399 COVID-19 deaths as Assam adds 1,347 backlog casualties
209.article_body: India reported 2,483 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The country reported 1,399 COVID-19 deaths as Assam and Kerala added 1,347 and 47 backlog casualties respectively. Active cases in India stand at 15,636, while the death toll has risen to 5,23,622, according to the data shared by the ministry.

210.title: 118-year-old French nun named world's oldest living person
210.article_body: After the death of Japan's Kane Tanaka aged 119, Guinness World Records said that 118-year-old Sister André, who was born on February 11, 1904, is now officially the oldest person alive. Sister André had worked as a teacher, a governess and looked after children during World War II. She's the third-oldest French person and the third-oldest European person ever recorded.

211.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal shares pic from hospital after 6-hour breast cancer surgery
211.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from the hospital after undergoing a six-hour breast cancer surgery. "I woke up cancer free...It's a long road to recovery, but the great thing is...it's only going to get better now. The worst's over," she wrote. "Thank you guys for sticking with me through this," she added.

212.title: Man killed in mall in UP's Noida after fight with bar staff
212.article_body: A man was killed on Monday night in Gardens Galleria Mall in Uttar Pradesh's Noida, police said. "Some people got into a fight with bar staff during which one person was severely injured," Additional DCP Ranvijay Singh said. "He was taken to hospital, where doctors declared him dead and an FIR has been registered," Singh further said.

213.title: If Musk can afford Twitter, he can pay his taxes: US Congresswoman
213.article_body: US Congresswoman Marie Newman reacted to Elon Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal, saying, "If he can afford Twitter, he can damn well afford to pay his fair share in taxes." She highlighted that Musk had paid $0 in federal taxes in 2018. "We need a Billionaire Tax NOW," she added. US Senator Elizabeth Warren has called the deal "dangerous" for democracy.

214.title: Cong should take 'backseat' in states where regional parties are formidable: Tejashwi
214.article_body: Talking about forming a strong Opposition alliance against BJP in the 2024 general elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said that Congress should take a "backseat" in states where regional parties are a formidable force. Congress must focus on over 200 seats on which it is in a direct fight with the saffron party, Yadav added.

215.title: NATO warships arrive at Finland port for 2-day exercise
215.article_body: Three NATO warships have reached Finland's Turku port for a two-day training exercise with the Finnish navy. This comes amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The Latvian, Estonian and Dutch ships will train with two of Finland's minehunter vessels, according to Finnish defence forces. The exercise will begin on April 28.

216.title: Don't underestimate the risks of nuclear war, the danger is real: Russia to the world
216.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has told the world not to underestimate the risks of nuclear war. "The risks now are considerable," Lavrov said. "I would not want to elevate those risks artificially. Many would like that. The danger is serious, real," he further said. "This only means Moscow senses defeat," Ukraine said after Lavrov's statement.

217.title: Ban on carrying guns at wedding functions, parties under Sec 144 in MP's Morena
217.article_body: A ban on carrying guns in gatherings, including wedding functions and parties, has been imposed under Section 144 of the CrPC in Madhya Pradesh's Morena, in view of recent fatal incidents, police said. According to Morena Superintendent of Police (SP), all police stations have been asked to register a case and revoke licenses in case such incidents are reported again.

218.title: Allahabad HC dismisses PIL asking Adityanath to take oath in 'real name'
218.article_body: The Allahabad High Court dismissed a PIL seeking direction that UP CM Yogi Adityanath may be asked to take the oath as CM again in his "real name". According to the petitioner, different names were being used by the CM like "Adityanath", "Yogi Adityanath", etc. The High Court bench also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the petitioner.

219.title: J'khand CM used his position to give industrial land to wife: Ex-CM
219.article_body: Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das on Monday alleged that state CM Hemant Soren, who holds Industries portfolio, used his position to get 11 acres of land in Ranchi's industrial area allotted to his wife Kalpana. He claimed that Soren's political representative and media adviser were also given mining leases. "[Soren] is supposed to give answers," he said.

220.title: Dad worked round the clock, slept on sets; I'd miss having him at home: Bobby
220.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that as a child, he missed having his father and actor Dharmendra at home. "Sometimes he would take me to shoot locations but even then, he would be busy. He would literally be working round the clock, so that he could build a lovely empire for us. He would even sleep on sets," Bobby added.

221.title: Dalit man beaten to death over land dispute in UP's Firozabad
221.article_body: A Dalit man was allegedly beaten to death by a group of people belonging to the upper caste in UP's Firozabad district. According to Jai Singh's brother, few people had been pressuring him to vacate the plot he had purchased in 2021. An FIR was registered against six people and two of the accused have been arrested, police said.

222.title: Raj govt suspends 3 officials after 300-yr-old temple demolished in Alwar
222.article_body: Rajasthan government suspended three officials, including Rajgarh Sub-Divisional Magistrate, after a 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Alwar on Friday. The other suspended officials are Rajgarh Municipality Board's chairman and Executive Officer of the Nagar Panchayat. The demolition was done to remove illegal encroachments and the temple's idols, DM Shivprasad Nakate had said.

223.title: 'Grenade-like' rusted ball triggers bomb scare in Delhi's RK Puram
223.article_body: A 'grenade-like' device was spotted in Delhi's RK Puram area on Monday, after which, Delhi Police launched the bomb disposal protocols. A senior police officer said that the device was originally assumed to be a grenade but it was found to be a rusted ball after investigation. Police said they were taking all precautions.

224.title: 7 held for leaking question paper of Junior Office Assistant exam in Himachal
224.article_body: Police arrested seven persons from Mandi for allegedly leaking the question paper of the Junior Office Assistant exam conducted on Sunday by the Himachal Pradesh Staff Selection Commission. One accused revealed that a staffer at Abhilashi College of Education and deputy centre superintendent had provided him with the question paper before the commencement of the exam, a police official said.

225.title: Virat must stay patient at the start of innings, runs will come: Shastri
225.article_body: Ahead of RCB's match against RR, ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said RCB's top-order needs to step up if they want to go the distance in the ongoing IPL season. Talking about Virat Kohli's form, Shastri stated, "Virat must stay patient at the start, play grounded shots...I've no doubt that runs will start flowing. But he has to give it time."

226.title: Amid rumours of leaving Cong, Vijender Singh posts pic with Priyanka
226.article_body: Amid the ongoing rumours of boxer Vijender Singh leaving the Congress for AAP, the 36-year-old Olympic medallist posted a picture with senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday. "It was wonderful conversing with dynamic leader @priyankagandhi ji who is doing so much for the betterment of the youth. Her progressive approach can help us gain newer heights," read the caption.

227.title: PBKS' Arshdeep does 'chariot riding' celebration against CSK, IPL share video
227.article_body: PBKS fast bowler Arshdeep Singh celebrated taking the wicket of CSK's Mitchell Santner by doing a 'chariot riding' gesture. Reacting to Arshdeep's celebration, a fan wrote, "Love this celebration." Santner was clean bowled by Arshdeep for 9(15). Arshdeep recorded figures of 4-0-23-1 as PBKS defeated CSK by 11 runs.

228.title: Rishi Dhawan's glasses may have reminded him of something: Jaffer on Rayudu's 78(39)
228.article_body: Referring to Ambati Rayudu smashing 78(39) against PBKS, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Rayudu batting even more aggressively tonight. Rishi Dhawan's glasses may have reminded him of something." Jaffer was referring to Rayudu's 'Just ordered a new set of 3D glasses to watch World Cup' tweet which he posted in 2019 after not being included in India's World Cup squad.

229.title: 9 arrested for lynching Maha man over suspicion of stealing halogen light
229.article_body: Nine persons, including two sons of a former Shiv Sena corporator, have been arrested in Maharashtra's Aurangabad for allegedly lynching a 30-year-old man over suspicion of stealing a halogen light. The victim's family learnt about the incident after receiving a video footage of the assault, which was recorded by the accused. The family members showed the video to the police.

230.title: UK to send 'small number' of Stormer armoured vehicles to Ukraine
230.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Britain will send a "small number" of Stormer armoured vehicles fitted with launchers for anti-air missiles to Ukraine. He added that British assessments showed that around 15,000 Russian personnel have been killed in the war. Russia has lost over 2,000 armoured vehicles and more than 60 helicopters and fighter planes, he further said.

231.title: Billionaires like Musk play by different rules: US Senator on Twitter deal
231.article_body: US Senator Elizabeth Warren reacted to Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, saying, "Billionaires like Elon Musk play by a different set of rules than everyone else, accumulating power for their own gain." She also called the deal "dangerous for our democracy". "We need a wealth tax and strong rules to hold Big Tech accountable," Warren added.

232.title: BMC develops software for tracking & updates on nullah cleaning work
232.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has developed a software where citizens would be able to track the nullah cleaning work in their localities. Updates related to cleaning work will also be uploaded on software. Officials said software will provide details like areas where nullahs were cleaned, quantity of silt deposited at dumping sites and silt removed on a particular day.

233.title: Passenger shares pic of broken armrest on Air India plane; DGCA says 'repair it'
233.article_body: DGCA has asked Tata Group-owned Air India to repair its aircraft after a passenger shared pictures of the plane's dirty panel and broken armrest on social media. DGCA asked the airline to rectify the problem as soon as possible. The plane will be in Kolkata on Monday night and the repair works will be done during that time, officials said.

234.title: Delhi AIIMS nurses union go on indefinite strike from today
234.article_body: Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) nurses union began an indefinite strike at 8 am on Tuesday. This comes after union's president Harish Kajla was suspended after protests over staff shortage. The union demanded immediate revocation of Kajla's suspension and stopping of all kinds of retaliative measures against union executives and union members of the main OT.

235.title: Elon is the singular solution I trust: Jack Dorsey on Musk's $44-bn Twitter takeover
235.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter, the micro-blogging platform's billionaire  Co-founder Jack Dorsey tweeted, "In principle...I don’t believe anyone should own or run Twitter." He added, "It wants to be a public good at a protocol level, not a company. Solving for the problem of it being a company however...Elon is the singular solution I trust."

236.title: My number got leaked online; random people used to call me everyday: Divyenndu
236.article_body: Recalling an incident from the past where he used to get random calls, 'Mirzapur' actor Divyenndu Sharma said, "After 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', my number got leaked on the internet, and I used to get random calls from people." "Then one...day, one of my fans messaged me that my number was...on the internet and...I needed to change my number," he added.

237.title: 81.5 kg marijuana seized in Bengaluru; 2 arrested
237.article_body: Two persons were arrested while attempting to smuggle 81.5 kg marijuana in Bengaluru on Monday, said police. The accused, identified as Eeneshwar and Nadeem, both aged 25, reportedly used to get the drugs from their suppliers in Andhra Pradesh and bring it to Bengaluru, hidden in goods vehicles. The two have been booked under NDPS Act.

238.title: Morgan Stanley acting as Musk's lead adviser in $44 bn Twitter deal
238.article_body: Morgan Stanley is acting as Elon Musk's lead adviser in his $44 billion Twitter deal. Bank of America and Barclays have also advised him. At least nine other banks are reportedly helping Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and Barclays provide $25.5 billion in debt for the deal. Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, and boutique investment bank Allen advised Twitter.

239.title: Punjab police constable arrested for taking bribe
239.article_body: A constable in the Punjab police was arrested for allegedly taking a bribe from a car driver. The constable, identified as Harpreet Singh, tried to flee after Mohali's Kharar police officials came to arrest him. The complaint was made by Inspector Satinder Singh who alleged that the car driver was demanding his money back from Constable Harpreet Singh.

240.title: As a tax payer I want to know why is there a power crisis in Jharkhand: Sakshi Dhoni
240.article_body: Sakshi Dhoni, wife of former India cricket captain MS Dhoni, on Monday tweeted, "As a tax payer of Jharkhand just want to know why is there a power crisis in Jharkhand since so many years?" "We are doing our part by consciously making sure we save energy," she wrote. This comes as load shedding is being done in Jharkhand.

241.title: Vijay hosts dinner for cast and crew of 'Beast', director Nelson pens note
241.article_body: Actor Vijay hosted dinner for the cast and crew of his latest movie 'Beast'. The dinner was attended by Pooja Hegde, Anirudh Ravichander, Aparna Das and director Nelson Dilipkumar. Nelson on Monday took to Twitter to share a picture from the dinner party with a note that read, "It was a fun-filled and memorable evening with the whole team."

242.title: Chhattisgarh makes face masks compulsory again amid COVID-19 surge
242.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government on Monday decided to reimpose COVID-19 protocols, including mandatory wearing of masks in offices and public places, in view of rising COVID-19 cases in some states. "Spitting at public places is prohibited. Social distancing norms will have to be followed in public places," the order states. Chhattisgarh had lifted the mask mandate on April 12.

243.title: Won't return to Twitter even if account reinstated after Musk takeover: Trump
243.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has said he'll not return to social media platform Twitter even if his account is reinstated following the platform's purchase by billionaire Elon Musk. Trump added he will formally join his own Truth Social startup over the next seven days. "Musk will make improvements to Twitter and he is a good man," Trump further said.

244.title: Centre writes to Raj over Class 12 exam paper questions on Congress
244.article_body: Union Education Ministry has written a letter to the Rajasthan government asking for its input on news reports that the state board's Class 12 political science paper had six questions about Congress' "achievements". The questions asked included- 'Discuss in brief the Congress as a Social and Ideological Alliance' and 'Which party dominated the first three general elections in India?'

245.title: In a first, Karnataka govt hospital gets hyperbaric oxygen unit
245.article_body: In a first for a government facility in Karnataka, Bengaluru's Victoria Hospital got a hyperbaric oxygen chamber set up at ₹3.5 crore. It is an airtight room, pressurised with pure oxygen, used in the treatment of carbon monoxide poisoning, gangrene, wounds and other conditions. Inaugurating the facility, Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said the treatment sessions would be free.

246.title: Demolition drive begins to clear encroachments from Gurugram's Banjara market
246.article_body: Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) demolished over 14 acres of makeshift shops and hutments to reclaim encroached land at Banjara market located in Gurugram's Sectors 52A and 53. The entire encroached land would be cleared in a two-day drive, officials said. Home decor and furniture items were sold in the Banjara market inhabited by Gadiya Lohars nomadic community.

247.title: Playing the lead is my priority right now: Shefali Shah
247.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said playing the lead role is her priority right now. "Writers are writing stuff for me. Directors are working on projects thinking of me. I've waited for a very long time for this," Shefali said, adding, "I'm glad that people are finally looking at me as a lead or...parallel lead...That's what I want to keep doing."

248.title: I focus on process, result will take care of itself: Dhawan on 88*(59) vs CSK
248.article_body: PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, who was named Man of the Match for his unbeaten 88-run knock against CSK, said he's focusing on the "process" in the ongoing IPL season. "The process, I always talk about it, I focus on it. About my fitness, my approach, I keep working on those skills. The result will take care of itself," he stated.

249.title: 124 districts in India reported 'zero' malaria cases: Mandaviya
249.article_body: India has made remarkable progress in its fight against malaria, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on World Malaria Day on Monday. He added that 124 districts in India have reported “zero” malaria cases. There is a need for frontline health workers such as ASHAs and ANMs to raise awareness about the diagnosis and treatment of the disease, Mandaviya stated.

250.title: Played waiter in Shool; they said they'll pay ₹2,500, never got it: Nawazuddin
250.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said that he played a waiter in 'Shool'. "They said they will pay me ₹2,500, but I've never gotten it...There have been many such cases...but this one I remember very well," he said, adding, "I visited their office...for 6-7 months...They wouldn't pay me....but offered me food...So then I started visiting them at lunch time...my money got settled."

251.title: Hyd police arrest 3 inter-state drug traffickers, seize 78 kg ganja
251.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that an inter-state drug trafficking racket has been busted and three people were arrested in the matter. The police added that they have also seized about 78 kg of ganja, three mobile phones and two four-wheelers from the accused. The drugs were found during checking near Keesara, the police further said.

252.title: It's important to respect Sonam's privacy: Harsh Varrdhan on sister's pregnancy
252.article_body: Speaking about her sister, actress Sonam Kapoor's pregnancy, actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor said, "I think it's nice that everybody is kind of wanting to know about her because Sonam is such a big personality. So, obviously, everybody wants to share that happiness." "[But] it would also be important to respect [her] privacy...give [her] that space as well," he added.

253.title: Finland, Sweden to apply for NATO membership together in May: Reports
253.article_body: Finland and Sweden will apply for NATO membership together in May this year, local media reported on Monday. Finland, which shares a 1,300-km border with Russia, and Sweden are considering joining the US-led military alliance following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has warned that it'd deploy nuclear weapons and hypersonic missiles in the region if both nations join the alliance.

254.title: Commonwealth medallist among 5 held for robbing Hisar bank of ₹16.19 lakh
254.article_body: The Hisar STF on Monday arrested five persons, including a junior Commonwealth Games gold medallist for robbing ₹16.19 lakh from a bank in Hisar on April 18, police said. The Commonwealth Games medallist, Soni, is also serving in the ITBP. "Soni had prepared the plan which he executed with four aides," Hisar SSP, Lokender Singh, said.

255.title: Hyderabad Police arrests vehicle thief, recovers 2 stolen two-wheelers
255.article_body: Hyderabad's Gopalapuram Police on Monday arrested a 42-year-old man for stealing vehicles and recovered two stolen two-wheelers from his possession. According to police, the accused, identified as Pinnoji Jagadish, was arrested following a complaint from a teacher whose bike was stolen from Keyes High School on Sunday. Jagadish was travelling on the stolen bike when he was arrested, police said.

256.title: Heroin worth ₹21 cr seized from Malawian national at Hyderabad airport
256.article_body: Officials of Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested a Malawian national at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (RGIA) with heroin worth ₹21 crore. "The contraband was tightly packed in two polythene covers and was ingeniously concealed in a specially created false bottom, at the base of...trolley bag," the DRI said. The accused was remanded to judicial custody on Monday.

257.title: Massive fire breaks out in garbage pile in Gurugram, 35 fire engines deployed
257.article_body: A massive fire broke out near Sector-6 in a garbage pile in Gurugram's Manesar on Monday night. As many as 35 fire engines have been deployed at the spot, officials said. The videos which have surfaced online show huge flames and a cloud of smoke rising from the area. There are no reports of casualties or injuries as of yet.

258.title: No job cuts at the time: Twitter CEO as Elon Musk acquires company for $44 billion
258.article_body: After Elon Musk struck a deal to acquire Twitter for $44 billion, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told the employees that there won't be any job cuts "at the time". "Once the deal closes...we don't know which direction [Twitter] will go," he added. Parag reportedly told Twitter employees that Musk's transaction to take Twitter private could take six months to complete.

259.title: Why did Rishi Dhawan wear a face shield in match against CSK?
259.article_body: PBKS' Rishi Dhawan was seen wearing a face shield while bowling against CSK. Ahead of IPL 2022, the 32-year-old all-rounder was hit in the face during the second round of Ranji Trophy. He was taken to hospitals and subsequently underwent a nose surgery. He was seen wearing the face shield for protection while practising in the nets as well.

260.title: 2 killed, 4 injured in building collapse incident in Delhi's Satya Niketan
260.article_body: Two labourers died and four others sustained injuries after a building undergoing renovation collapsed on them in Delhi's Satya Niketan on Monday. The men were reportedly stuck for hours as multiple teams tried to remove debris and rescue them. "The slab (terrace) was tilted and it was difficult to reach the victims," Delhi Fire Services (DFS) Director Atul Garg said.

261.title: Had Jadeja scored quickly, CSK might've had 17 to chase in final over: RP Singh
261.article_body: Ex-India bowler RP Singh has said had CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja batted with a higher strike rate against PBKS, they "might've had 17-18 runs to chase in the final over". Jadeja came in to bat during the 13th over when they were 89/4 and scored 21 off 16. In the end, CSK needed 27 in the final over to win.

262.title: Dogecoin Co-creator likes post that called Musk's Twitter deal 'shameful'
262.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus liked a post on Twitter that called Elon Musk's Twitter deal "shameful" and said he could have given $1 million to every person in the world instead. "I know! Why didn't he fix all my specific problems exclusively instead of doing what he wanted with his own money," Markus said jokingly.

263.title: Ensure tanker water supply in 23 merged villages: HC to Pune civic body
263.article_body: Bombay HC directed Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to ensure tanker water supply to 23 merged villages. "We've other matters...some villages in Maharashtra are facing acute problems of supply of water, including potable water," HC said. "Maharashtra government has erred in giving Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority the developmental rights for 23 merged villages," an official said.

264.title: WB teen who set herself ablaze after threats from man dies in hospital
264.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who had set herself on fire on April 14, after she received threats from man who had allegedly tried to rape her in February died in hospital on Monday. "My daughter suffered more than 60% burns...I demand probe by Central Bureau of Investigation although local police have arrested the accused and his brother," her father said.

265.title: Actress Jameela Jamil quits Twitter after Elon Musk buys it for $44 billion
265.article_body: Actress Jameela Jamil announced that she's leaving Twitter after Elon Musk purchased the platform for $44 billion. "Ah he got twitter...I'd like this to be my what lies here as my last tweet...I fear this free speech bid is going to help this hell platform reach its final form of totally lawless hate, bigotry, and misogyny...Best of luck," she wrote.

266.title: Nursing officer suspended at AIIMS Delhi over staff shortage strike
266.article_body: A nursing officer of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi was suspended after protests by a group of nurses in the main operation theatre on April 23 led to cancellation of at least 50 planned surgeries. The nurses were protesting over staff shortage. The Resident Doctors' Association of AIIMS demanded the nursing officer Harish Kumar Kajla's suspension.

267.title: 27-year-old woman sexually assaulted by man near bus stop in Pune
267.article_body: A case has been filed after a 27-year-old woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by a man near Chakan bus stop in Pune. The woman, who'd left her house after a fight with her live-in partner,  was sleeping with her minor son in the bus stop's night guard's room when the accused pulled her out and sexually assaulted her, police said.

268.title: Twitter CEO Parag set to receive $42 mn if terminated after Musk's takeover: Reports
268.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal would get an estimated $42 million if he is terminated within 12 months of a change in control at the social media company, according to reports quoting research firm Equilar. Musk in a securities filing had said he did not have confidence in Twitter's management. Musk has struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

269.title: Intention was to kill: Police in Shahdara gang-rape case charge-sheet
269.article_body: Delhi Police filed charge-sheet in Shahdara gang-rape case and said the crime was committed with the intention of killing the victim, a 20-year-old woman, and taking revenge for a minor's death. "The minor died by suicide in November 2021...his family blamed the victim for it," police added. The woman was gang-raped and paraded with a blackened face on January 26.

270.title: Home guard saves woman from slipping under moving local train in Mumbai
270.article_body: An alert home guard deployed on a suburban local train in Mumbai saved a woman from falling into the gap between the train and the platform. The woman, who lost balance after landing on the platform while deboarding the moving train, continued to hold onto the train. She was pulled ahead as train began to gain momentum.

271.title: Involve children in sports else they will be engaged on screen: SC
271.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday sought the response of the Centre and states to a petition that asked to make sports or physical literacy a fundamental right under the Constitution. Dealing with the petition, the bench said, “Children involved in sports will be something very useful, otherwise they will end up spending time on screen (gadgets).”

272.title: Man says boys smoking ganja in temple ground, Mumbai Police responds
272.article_body: A Twitter user, in his tweet, said that some young boys were smoking ganja in a temple ground in Mumbai's Malvani. "[They are] fighting with locals when they tried to stop them from sitting," the tweet said. Mumbai Police replied to him saying they have informed the main control room about the issue.

273.title: I want to make Twitter better than ever: Musk after $44 bn takeover deal finalised
273.article_body: Elon Musk, after finalising his $44 billion Twitter buyout deal, said, "I want to make Twitter better than ever by enhancing the product with new features." He added that he looks to make Twitter better by "making the algorithms open source to increase trust, defeating the spam bots, and authenticating all humans". He added, "Twitter has tremendous potential."

274.title: Free speech bedrock of functioning democracy: Musk as Twitter accepts buyout offer
274.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk said, "Free speech is the bedrock of a functioning democracy," after Twitter accepted his offer to take the social media company private for approximately $44 billion. He added, "Twitter is the digital town square where matters vital to the future of humanity are debated." Musk will buy each Twitter share for $54.20 in cash.

275.title: Twitter impacts the entire world: CEO Parag as Musk bags deal to buy Twitter
275.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal took to Twitter after the world's richest man Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter was accepted by the social media company's board. "Twitter has a purpose and relevance that impacts the entire world," tweeted Agrawal. He added, "Deeply proud of our teams and inspired by the work that has never been more important."

276.title: Elon Musk to buy Twitter for $44 billion
276.article_body: Twitter has accepted the world's richest man Elon Musk's bid to take over the social media company. It entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by an entity wholly owned by Musk, for $54.20 per share in cash in a transaction valued at approximately $44 billion. Upon completion of the transaction, Twitter will become a privately held company.

277.title: Chandigarh makes masks mandatory in closed environment
277.article_body: The Chandigarh administration on Monday made the wearing of masks compulsory in closed environments including public spaces, public transport and educational institutions amid a COVID-19 surge. The administration also stated that non-compliance with the order would invite a fine of ₹500. Chandigarh on Monday reported nine new COVID-19 cases, taking the city's total tally to 92,007 cases.

278.title: PBKS end their 2-match losing streak, hand CSK their 6th defeat in IPL 2022
278.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) defeated Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 11 runs in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. With this, PBKS ended their two-match losing streak and jumped to the sixth position on the points table, while CSK have now lost six matches in the tournament. PBKS' Shikhar Dhawan top-scored in the match with 88*(59).

279.title: Not right to cancel 23 passenger trains: Chhattisgarh CM
279.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel asked the Centre to reconsider the decision of halting the rail operations of 23 passenger trains. The upgradation work passing through the state is the reason for the halting of the South East Central Railway divisions. "It is not right to cancel passenger trains at this time because summer vacations are approaching," the CM said.

280.title: No alternative to TRS in Telangana, Opposition is hopeless: KTR
280.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) working President KT Rama Rao said that there is no alternative to the TRS in Telangana for the next year's state Assembly elections. "We have worked hard and delivered on the promises we made. The Opposition has been hopeless," he said. "I believe there's no Opposition to TRS," he added.

281.title: SC stays action on slum dwellers in Sarojini Nagar till next week
281.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday directed not to take any coercive action against slum dwellers of the Sarojini Nagar area of New Delhi until further orders. The SC told Additional Solicitor General (ASG) KM Nataraj, who appeared for the Centre, "Deal with them humanely...You can't say you won't have the policy to rehabilitate and simply throw them away."

282.title: 16, including a Bangladeshi, arrested in Assam for terror links
282.article_body: Assam Police arrested 16 people including one Bangladeshi terrorist from different parts of the state as they all had links with terrorist groups, Ansarul Bangla Team and Al-Qaida Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). “Out of them, one named Md Suman alias Saiful Islam hailing from Bangladesh's Narayanganj is the kingpin. He escaped from Bangladesh,” Additional Director General of Police, Hiren Nath said.

283.title: BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of PM Modi's govt
283.article_body: To mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government, a team of 12 senior BJP leaders met on Monday, to plan a big outreach programme. To celebrate the occasion, grand programmes will be organised all over the country. The meeting included Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP general secretaries among others.

284.title: India, Russia in talks to restart coking coal supplies: Report
284.article_body: Indian and Russian officials held talks in New Delhi last week where Russia urged India to move forward with their last year's deal on coking coal imports, Reuters reported. Since March, Russian coal supply to India has stopped amid Western sanctions. Meanwhile, India's top coking coal supplier Australia has raised its prices from $200 to $700 per tonne.

285.title: Meghan might leave Harry, their marriage will end badly: Donald Trump
285.article_body: Ex-US President and former reality TV star Donald Trump has claimed that Meghan Markle's marriage to Prince Harry "will end and it will end [badly]". He also claimed that she might leave Harry "when she decides that she likes some other guy better". "Poor Harry is being led around by his nose. And I think he's an embarrassment," said Trump.

286.title: Russell's shot makes a hole in chair during net practice; KKR shares video
286.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) Andre Russell's shot broke a chair while the all-rounder was batting at the nets. KKR's official Instagram account shared a video of the incident and wrote, "Wait for the #MuscleRussell impact at the end!" The Windies all-rounder is the second-highest run-scorer from the KKR in the ongoing edition of the IPL.

287.title: CSK know how to bring their A-game when the business end arrives: Jaffer
287.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said defending champions CSK can certainly make a comeback with the way they won their two matches in the ongoing IPL so far. He added that CSK have many experienced players in their side who have won IPL in the past and they know how to bring their A-game when the business end arrives.

288.title: You can't help but give him another go: Pollock on MI's Shokeen
288.article_body: Ex-South Africa skipper Shaun Pollock praised MI debutant Hrithik Shokeen, saying he's impressed with the 21-year-old spinner. He added that MI can't help it but give him another chance as he was impressive on his IPL debut against CSK. Shokeen posted bowling figures of 4-0-23-0. He retained his place in the team for MI's next game against LSG.

289.title: Pic of PBKS' Rishi Dhawan wearing face guard while bowling goes viral, fans react
289.article_body: PBKS all-rounder Rishi Dhawan was seen wearing a face guard while bowling against CSK. Sharing a picture on Instagram, IPL wrote, "Well...this is new. What do you reckon of this bowling gear?" "Good innovation for safety," a fan commented. Another wrote, "Hoping that Rishi wearing a face shield can be a beginning...revolution regarding bowlers being more proactive with their safety."

290.title: Musk's Boring Company to start testing Hyperloop at full-scale this year
290.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk's The Boring Company will begin testing high-speed transport system Hyperloop at full-scale later this year. Earlier today, Musk tweeted, "In the coming years, Boring Company will attempt to build a working Hyperloop." He noted that Hyperloop would be the fastest way of getting from one city centre to another for distances less than 3,220 km.

291.title: We know how to crush 'Dadagiri': Maha CM on Hanuman Chalisa issue
291.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has reacted to the Hanuman Chalisa controversy and said, "It's being said that we've ignored Hindutva. Is Hindutva a dhoti or what? Our Hindutva is 'Gada Dhari' like Lord Hanuman's Gada." He added, "If you want to recite Hanuman Chalisa, call and come home. But if you resort to 'Dadagiri', we know how to crumble it."

292.title: Housing prices may sustainably rise 8% this fiscal: India Ratings
292.article_body: India Ratings and Research on Monday said housing prices are expected to rise by 8% this fiscal mainly due to a rise in demand. "The price hike will be sustainable and is likely to be incremental. Prices were up 6% pan-India in FY22," the agency said. It expects the affordable housing segment to continue claiming around 50% of total sales.

293.title: Authoritarians are threat to comedy, art, music, poetry: Jon Stewart
293.article_body: Comedian Jon Stewart received Mark Twain Prize for American Humor on Sunday. While receiving the award, Jon said the "fragility of leaders" is the threat to comedy and not the "fragility of audiences". "When society is under threat, comedians are the ones who get sent away first...Authoritarians are...threat to comedy, to art, to music, to thought, to poetry," he added.

294.title: West trying to murder Russian journalists: Putin amid Ukraine war
294.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday accused West of plotting murders of Russian journalists amid Ukraine war, an allegation Kyiv has denied. Putin claimed that Russia's Federal Security Service had thwarted murder attempt by "terrorist group" on journalist Vladimir Solovyev. He made the remarks while interacting with prosecutors, demanding them to take a tough line against 'foreign spies'.

295.title: RBI imposes ₹1.12 crore penalty on Bank of Maharashtra
295.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India said it has imposed a monetary penalty of ₹1.12 crore on Bank of Maharashtra for non-compliance. As per RBI, the non-compliance is related to certain directions under KYC. The state-run bank failed to allot Unique Customer Identification Codes to its individual customers and to review the outsourcing arrangement for an outsourced financial service, RBI added.

296.title: Centre should make rules about loudspeakers: Maharashtra minister
296.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Monday said that "the Centre should make rules regarding loudspeakers at the national level, then the problem arising in the states will not take place." He along with Environment Minister Aditya Thackeray held a presser to discuss the state's law and order situation. The statement comes amid the loudspeaker controversy in Maharashtra.

297.title: India buys twice as much Russian oil in 2 months than in 2021: Report
297.article_body: India has bought over twice the amount of crude oil from Russia in the last two months than it did in entire 2021, Reuters reported. As per the report, Indian refiners have placed orders for at least 40 million barrels of Russian oil since Ukraine's invasion on February 24. Russia is selling oil at steep discounts amid Western sanctions.

298.title: The rawness that Irrfan had, Babil carries that: 'Qala' producer
298.article_body: 'Qala' producer Karnesh Ssharma in an interview has stated that late veteran actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil carries the same rawness that the former had. Babil will make his Bollywood debut with 'Qala' alongside actress Tripti Dimri. "A humble request would be to let him express himself and enjoy what he has done, rather than putting pressure," Karnesh added.

299.title: Yes Bank files insolvency plea against Zee over ₹468 cr default
299.article_body: Yes Bank has moved the National Company Law Tribunal seeking to initiate corporate insolvency proceedings against Zee Learn, claiming a default of ₹468 crore. As per Zee Learn, it received a notice from the Mumbai bench of the NCLT over Yes Bank's petition on Monday. It is in the process of compiling information to verify the facts, the company added.

300.title: 192.74 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses given to states & UTs: Govt
300.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare informed that more than 192.74 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been provided to the states and Union Territories to date by the Centre. The Government of India has been providing the states and UTs with free COVID-19 vaccines. The nationwide vaccination drive began on January 16, 2021.

301.title: Air India loses preferential access to int'l traffic rights
301.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) dropped a clause that gave the former national carrier, Air India, preferential access to international traffic rights over private airlines. As per the revised circular, the government may now grant or deny allocation of traffic rights to any airline based on its "preparedness" and "viability" of operations on a route, among other factors.

302.title: LIC IPO to open on May 4 and close on May 9: Reports
302.article_body: The initial public offering (IPO) of Life Insurance Corporation of India will likely open on May 4 and close on May 9, reports said on Monday. The IPO, through which the government will sell a 3.5% stake in the state-owned firm, is expected to fetch ₹21,000 crore to the exchequer. The IPO size was scaled down from 5% earlier.

303.title: Veranda Learning to buy 30-yr-old test prep firm T.I.M.E. for ₹287 crore
303.article_body: Edtech company Veranda Learning on Monday said it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire T.I.M.E. (Advanced Educational Activities Pvt Ltd) for ₹287 crore. The acquisition will be conducted in two phases, 80% in the first phase, and the remaining 20% at the end of two years. Established in 1992, T.I.M.E. is a leading test-prep chain with a pan-India presence.

304.title: Ajay Devgn turns rapper for 'Runway 34' song 'Jalaya Toh Nahin'
304.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has collaborated with musician Yashraj Mukhate to rap in song 'Jalaya Toh Nahin' for his upcoming film 'Runway 34'. Yashraj shared the video on Instagram, writing, "This was sooo much fun!! @ajaydevgn sir doing a rap section for the first time in a track that I made. Isn't that insane?" The film also stars Amitabh Bachchan.

305.title: Director Om Raut, Abhishek Bachchan in talks for a project: Report
305.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut is reportedly in talks with actor Abhishek Bachchan for his upcoming project. A source quoted by Pinkvilla said, "It's in the action-drama space...Om feels that Abhishek fits the part to the T...the actor has liked the subject too." "However, the conversations are still at the nascent stage," the source added.  Abhishek was recently seen in 'Dasvi'.

306.title: No hope from PM Modi's Jammu visit: Mehbooba Mufti
306.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said her party did not see any hope in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's speech in Jammu. "He (PM) comes to visit Jammu and Kashmir, which he left no stone unturned to destroy. Our rights have been snatched. We have been reduced from a state to a Union Territory," she said.

307.title: Didn't mean to incite religious tensions: Navneet Rana to Om Birla
307.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana wrote to Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla saying that she wanted to "rekindle the flame of Hindutva in Shiv Sena" and didn't "mean to incite religious tensions" by chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. Rana also stated that she invited Thackeray to chant Hanuman Chalisa adding that her actions were not against him.

308.title: TMC will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam, form govt in 2026: Bora
308.article_body: Newly-appointed Trinamool Congress (TMC) Assam unit chief Ripun Bora asserted on Monday that the party will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam and form the government in 2026 state Assembly polls. He claimed that residents of Assam will embrace TMC as it's the only opposition party in the state. Bora resigned from Congress and joined TMC on April 17.

309.title: I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter: Elon Musk
309.article_body: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hope that even my worst critics remain on Twitter, because that is what free speech means." His tweet came after several reports claimed that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer to buy the company. Republicans cheered the potential Twitter deal, hoping the former US President Donald Trump will return to Twitter.

310.title: Salman Khan to begin shooting for 'Kabhi Eid...' on May 15: Report
310.article_body: Salman Khan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' on May 15. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, the shooting will take place in Mumbai. "Farhad Samji (director) has already begun work on the pre-production formalities, and is excited to start filming," the source added. Actress Pooja Hegde will also feature in the film.

311.title: Strengthening ties with India a priority in upcoming decades: EU chief
311.article_body: Speaking at the seventh edition of Raisina Dialogue, European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said that for European Union (EU), prioritising and energising ties with India is a priority in the upcoming decades. "As vibrant democracies, India-EU share fundamental values and common interests...Both the economies thrive in the world of common rules in a fair competition," she added.

312.title: Depp heard calling Amber ‘fat a**’ and ‘c***’ in recordings played during trial
312.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp was heard calling ex-wife Amber Heard "fat a**" and "c***" in recordings of their arguments played in court during his defamation suit trial on Monday. In one of the clips, Heard, who has accused Depp of abuse, reportedly screamed and told Depp to "put his cigarettes out on someone else". Depp denied committing the alleged act.

313.title: Meta to open its first physical retail store in US next month, Zuckerberg shares pics
313.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Instagram to share that the company will open its first physical retail space, called 'Meta Store', on May 9. The 1,550 sq ft storefront is situated on Meta's campus in Burlingame, California. The store will let customers "get hands-on experience" with its Portal videophones, Ray-Ban Stories smart glasses and Quest 2 virtual reality headsets.

314.title: Musk tweets 'And be my love in the rain' amid reports of Twitter takeover deal
314.article_body: Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "And be my love in the rain." His tweet came after several reports said that Twitter is set to accept Musk's $43-billion takeover offer. Responding to Musk's tweet, Dogecoin's co-creator tweeted, "The birds have less to say for themselves...In the wood-world's torn despair...Than now these numberless years the elves...Although they are no less there."

315.title: Will Smith in India to meet Sadhguru over Oscars controversy: Report
315.article_body: Actor Will Smith is visiting India to meet Sadhguru following the controversy at the 2022 Oscars when he slapped comedian Chris Rock, as per reports. The actor was spotted at a private airport in Mumbai in his first public appearance since the incident. He had earlier apologised to Chris in an Instagram post. The Academy banned Will for ten years.

316.title: Prashant Kishor hasn't said if he's joining Congress: KT Rama Rao
316.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) KT Rama Rao reacted to speculations of poll strategist Prashant Kishor's induction to Congress, stating that Kishor hadn't confirmed if he was joining party. Rao earlier called Congress a "redundant institution", adding that TRS has no ties with it. Notably, TRS has hired Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign in 2023 state Assembly polls.

317.title: Eveready Industries reports ₹38.41 crore loss in Q4 FY22
317.article_body: Eveready Industries on Monday reported consolidated net loss of ₹38.41 crore in the January-March quarter. The company had posted net loss of ₹442.53 crore in Q4 FY21, it said in a regulatory filing. Its revenue from operations in Q4 FY22 rose 17.82% YoY from ₹249.81 crore in Q4 FY21 to ₹294.33 crore while its total expenses stood at ₹241.23 crore.

318.title: Shikhar Dhawan crosses 6,000 IPL runs, 9,000 T20 runs in his 200th IPL match
318.article_body: Playing in his 200th IPL match, Punjab Kings (PBKS) opener Shikhar Dhawan on Monday crossed 6,000 runs in IPL and 9,000 runs in T20 cricket. He became the second batter after Virat Kohli to score 6,000 runs in IPL history. Dhawan is the third Indian after Kohli and Rohit Sharma to score 9,000 runs in T20 cricket.

319.title: Kishan has struggled a bit in IPL 2022, will talk to him soon: Jayawardena
319.article_body: Speaking about Ishan Kishan, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said the opener has been struggling with his form "a little", adding that he'll have a conversation with him soon. Kishan has scored 199 runs in eight IPL 2022 matches so far, including two fifties in the first two matches. Kishan was bought by MI for ₹15.25 crore in mega auction.

320.title: All schools closed in Odisha till April 30 in view of heatwave conditions
320.article_body: All government and private schools in Odisha will remain closed for five days starting April 26 (Tuesday) in view of the heatwave predicted there. However, scheduled examinations by the Odisha board of secondary education and council of higher education will continue. As many as 27 places in the state recorded a maximum temperature of 40°C or above on Monday.

321.title: Charge us with sedition for reciting Hanuman Chalisa: Fadnavis
321.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he'll chant the Hanuman Chalisa everyday and dared the Maharashtra government to charge him with sedition. Referring to the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and MLA Ravi Rana, Fadnavis said, "Will Hanuman Chalisa be recited in Pakistan, if not Maharashtra? The way Navneet and Ravi were treated is condemnable. What was their crime?"

322.title: Britney Spears announces she's taking short break from social media
322.article_body: Taking to Instagram, singer Britney Spears has said that she will be taking a short break from social media amid her pregnancy. "I'm going on a social media hiatus for a little while!!! I send my love and God bless you all," Britney wrote. She shared a video of a baby wearing sunglasses and sitting on a chair.

323.title: CSK will be very successful under Ravindra Jadeja: Rayudu
323.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu has said the franchise will be very successful under their new captain Ravindra Jadeja. The 33-year-old took over as the skipper of CSK after MS Dhoni relinquished captaincy in March. "He [Jadeja] has it in him to not only lead CSK but also India one day," he added. CSK are currently ninth in IPL 2022 standings.

324.title: No 'political twist' in Bihar, RJD not aligned with BJP, allies: Tejashwi
324.article_body: Reacting to speculations about 'political re-alignment' in Bihar after CM Nitish Kumar attended a Rashtriya Janata Dal-hosted (RJD) Iftar party, Tejashwi Yadav said that RJD has never aligned itself with RSS, BJP, or its allies. He added that RJD's opinions are not formed on "ideology of convenience". He further stated that politicians across party lines had been invited to event.

325.title: Open to implementing Uniform Civil Code but won't rush: Himachal CM
325.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Monday said that the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code in the neighbouring state of Uttarakhand has sent a "good message". The Himachal Pradesh government is "open to implementing it but it won't rush," he said. "We will examine the outcome of UCC in other states and then make a decision," Thakur said.

326.title: Illegal colonies in country a menace to urban development: SC
326.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday observed that the mushrooming of illegal colonies in India is a menace to urban development, adding that there's a need for state governments to prevent these from coming up. "We have seen floods in Hyderabad and Kerala, all this is because of irregular colonies," said a bench of Justices L Nageswara Rao and BR Gavai.

327.title: World's 6th richest man Buffett to auction one last private lunch for charity
327.article_body: Warren Buffett, the 91-year-old Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth richest person, will auction off a private lunch for one last time to raise money for charity. Buffett has held the lunch auction since 2000 and raised nearly $34.5 million for charity over the years. In 2019, cryptocurrency pioneer Justin Sun paid record $4,567,888 to dine with Buffett.

328.title: Delhi reports 1,011 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate jumps to 6.4%
328.article_body: Delhi has reported 1,011 fresh cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, marking the fourth day of over 1,000 new cases in the city. One related death was also recorded in Delhi in the last 24 hours while 817 people recovered from the disease in one day. The city's daily positivity rate jumped to 6.42% from 4.48% on Sunday.

329.title: Stupid, childish of him: Rahul Rawail on Deepak Tijori's claims on 'Anjaam'
329.article_body: 'Anjaam' director Rahul Rawail has responded to actor Deepak Tijori's claims about Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 1994 film 'Anjaam' saying it is "stupid and childish of him". Deepak had said that it's the only film he regrets doing because he wasn't happy with the way it was made. "Shah Rukh and I used to wonder, 'What's this director doing?'," Deepak said.

330.title: Angry Ola customer ties e-scooter to donkey, parades it around city in Maha
330.article_body: An angry Ola Electric customer tied his e-scooter to a donkey and paraded it with posters asking people not to trust the company in a city in Maharashtra's Beed district. The customer claims the e-scooter stopped working six days after it was purchased. The man said his scooter wasn't fixed and his calls to customer service led to "vague responses".

331.title: Thanks for putting me to good use: SRK to 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh' author
331.article_body: Writer Shrayana Bhattacharya, who wrote the book 'Desperately Seeking Shah Rukh', met the actor on Sunday and gave him a copy of her book. The actor gave Shrayana a handwritten note, writing, "Thank you for putting me to some good use. My love and thanks to you and all those wonderful women who like me so much."

332.title: K'taka makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID-19 surge
332.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday issued guidelines making face masks mandatory in public places, workplaces and on public transport amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in parts of the country. People have been asked to maintain social distancing, a minimum of two feet, in public places, an official order said. Spitting in public places will be punishable with a fine.

333.title: More than half of India’s 900 million workforce stop looking for jobs: Report
333.article_body: More than half of the 900 million Indians of legal working age aren't looking for jobs, data from the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) has indicated. In March 2022, the labour force shrunk by 3.8 million to 428 million, marking its lowest since July 2021, data showed. The overall labour participation rate dropped from 46% to 40% during 2017-2022.

334.title: Ex-Mumbai Mayor arrested over attack on Somaiya, granted bail later
334.article_body: Former Mumbai Mayor and Shiv Sena leader Vishwanath Mahadeshwar and three others were arrested on Monday in connection with an attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya. However, the ex-Mayor was granted bail on medical grounds later, Mumbai Police said. Somaiya had on Saturday claimed that he was injured in an alleged stone-pelting incident by Shiv Sena workers in Mumbai.

335.title: I'm trying very hard to do justice to Smita Patil's legacy: Prateik
335.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, speaking about his scene with his late mother Smita Patil's portrait in 'Cobalt Blue', has said, "It's a feeling I find difficult to articulate." "It will forever be a precious moment and memory for me," he added. Speaking about making correct career choices, Prateik said, "I'm...trying...hard...I hope people feel that I'm indeed doing justice to her legacy."

336.title: Have to take permission from wife Mira to spend money: Shahid Kapoor
336.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that he has to take permission from his wife Mira Rajput to spend money. "I would spend all out before but now I am a family man...I have to give it thought," he further stated. Shahid, however, added that he did not take permission for his recent boys' trip as it comes under his "rights".

337.title: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar marries Nikhil Bhargav
337.article_body: Kannada television actress Rashmi Prabhakar tied the knot with Nikhil Bhargav in Bengaluru on Monday. Nikhil works at an advertising agency and the couple met through mutual friends. Television actor Chandan Kumar shared a picture with the couple. Rashmi and Nikhil got engaged in November 2021. Their wedding was attended by family members and friends observing the COVID-19 norms.

338.title: Amazing to enter top-10 on same date as my idol Nadal: 18-yr-old Alcaraz
338.article_body: After entering top 10 for first time in his career at the age of 18 on Monday, Spain's Carlos Alcaraz said he's happy. He added that it's "amazing" to do it on same date like his idol Rafael Nadal did 17 years ago. Alcaraz climbed two spots from 11 to nine in ATP world rankings after winning 2022 Barcelona Open.

339.title: Cong has been tried, tested & dusted; see no future for it: KT Rama Rao
339.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said that Congress has been tried, tested and dusted, adding that he sees no future for the party. "We've no relations with Congress. It's a redundant institution. The people of India gave them opportunities for over 50 years. The country has been let down by Congress and BJP," he said.

340.title: Indian sailors held captive by Houthi rebels released: MEA
340.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said that seven Indian sailors, who were under the detention of Houthis in Yemen since January 2, 2022, have been released. According to MEA, the sailors reached Muscat, Oman, on April 24 and were expected to travel back to India shortly. The Centre thanked all the concerned authorities for the sailors' release.

341.title: HC refuses to quash FIR against Amravati MP and her MLA husband
341.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday refused to quash an FIR filed against Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana, both arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row. The concerned FIR alleged that the couple jostled and argued with the police when they were asked to get in the police vehicle after being arrested.

342.title: No need to display religious sentiments in public: Sharad Pawar
342.article_body: Amid a political row in Maharashtra over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said there is no need to display religious sentiments in public. "If efforts are made to spread hatred against communities or classes, adverse effects would be seen in society. Maharashtra never experienced this," he said.

343.title: Deposed Myanmar leader Suu Kyi awaits verdict in corruption case trial
343.article_body: A Myanmar court on Monday deferred its first verdict in corruption case trial of deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi, for which she could face jail time of up to 15 years. Her verdict was postponed to Tuesday, Reuters reported quoting a source. Suu Kyi, who was arrested during coup, has been accused of misappropriating charity money, among other allegations.

344.title: Poland, Sweden to organise donor conference to raise funds for Ukraine
344.article_body: Poland and Sweden will organise an international donor conference in Warsaw on May 5 to raise funds for Ukraine amid its invasion. "The conference will initiate a series of aid events...in...upcoming months," the event's press release stated. According to UN, an estimated 13 million people in Ukraine are in need of humanitarian aid, including shelter, food and medical supplies.

345.title: Twitter set to accept Musk's $43 billion offer: Report
345.article_body: Twitter is set to agree on its sale to the world's richest man, Elon Musk, for around $43 billion in cash, Reuters reported on Monday. It is the price that Musk had called his "best and final" offer for the social media company. Twitter may announce the $54.20-per-share deal later on Monday, Reuters added.

346.title: Musk responds to his alleged old e-mail on Twitter, Instagram; shares 'Instagram curse'
346.article_body: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter, responded to an e-mail he allegedly wrote in August 2018 about Twitter and Instagram. In the e-mail, Musk allegedly wrote, "Will tweet as I wish and suffer the consequences...I just deleted my Instagram. Weak sauce." On Monday, Musk responded to the e-mail by tweeting, "The Instagram curse: Water everywhere, yet always thirsty."

347.title: 'Ultimate finisher' Dhoni is the identity of IPL: Irfan Pathan
347.article_body: Calling MS Dhoni the "greatest and ultimate finisher" in IPL's history, Irfan Pathan said CSK wicketkeeper-batter is the identity of the league and its true ambassador. "Year after year, someone else has been joining this list but no one has been able to displace Dhoni," he added. Dhoni has scored 120 runs from seven matches in IPL 2022 so far.

348.title: Carlos Alcaraz is a future world number one: Prakash Amritraj
348.article_body: After Carlos Alcaraz won the Barcelona Open, former tennis player Prakash Amritraj took to Twitter and opined that the 18-year-old Spaniard will be men's world number one tennis player in the future. "He is going to be part of whatever big number exists at the time," Amritraj further tweeted. Carlos defeated Pablo Carreno Busta in the Barcelona Open final.

349.title: India finishes with 28 medals at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022
349.article_body: India ended its campaign at Brazil Para Badminton International 2022 in Sao Paulo with 28 medals, which includes eight golds, seven silvers and 13 bronzes, on Sunday.
