World number three Sukant Kadam won a silver in the SL4 category after losing to fellow Indian Tarun Dhillon in the final. Tokyo Paralympics gold medallist Pramod Bhagat secured 2 bronze medals.

350.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS, PBKS make 3 changes to their playing XI
350.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS have made three changes to their playing XI, with Shahrukh Khan, Nathan Ellis and Vaibhav Arora being replaced by Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Sandeep Sharma and Rishi Dhawan. CSK are fielding the same playing XI.

351.title: RBI moving towards managing inflation won't hurt growth: FM
351.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the RBI's plan to begin moving towards management of inflation wouldn't hurt India's economic growth. "The growth is not getting compromised, because [government] policies...have also been in such a way that supply-side supports have continued including infrastructure investments," she stated. She also defended RBI's timing to pivot toward inflation.

352.title: BMW to help create tool to trace carbon footprint of batteries
352.article_body: A group of 11 carmakers and battery producers, including BMW, has received $8.78 million from Germany to develop a "battery passport". The German government said the tool will trace the content and carbon footprint of batteries in Europe. This comes as from 2024, rechargeable EVs, light transport and industrial batteries sold in Europe might have to disclose their carbon footprint.

353.title: I'm typecast as 'urban girl next door', looking to break it: Barkha
353.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh in an interview has stated that she is often typecast as an urban girl next door", adding the magazine covers have called her the digital girl next door. "I'm looking to break out of that image to do something a little more desi. There has to be a way to come around it," the actress added.

354.title: India's GDP expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23: CII President
354.article_body: Confederation of Indian Industry's (CII) President TV Narendran said India's GDP is expected to grow 7.5-8% in FY23, with exports playing a key role. Referring to the Russia-Ukraine war, Narendran said no country can remain unaffected from events taking place outside its borders. "Even though India's...economic engagement with Russia or Ukraine is low, this does not shield us," he added.

355.title: He'll find a way to battle through it: Vettori on Kohli's form in IPL 2022
355.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form in IPL 2022, ex-New Zealand spinner Daniel Vettori said the RCB batter will find a way to battle through it, adding the way is through his "aggressive" nature. Kohli, who has scored 119 runs in eight matches so far with an average of 17, got out for golden ducks in the last two matches.

356.title: Indonesia's palm oil export ban will exclude crude palm oil: Reports
356.article_body: Palm oil companies were told by Indonesian government officials on Monday that the export ban on palm oil wouldn't cover export of crude palm oil, Reuters reported citing sources. President Joko Widodo had announced on Friday that palm oil exports would be banned in Indonesia from April 28. He said the export ban aims to ensure domestic food product availability.

357.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal dances in hospital before her breast cancer surgery
357.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently revealed that she is fighting breast cancer, danced in the hospital before her surgery. Sharing a video of her dance video on Instagram, the actress wrote, "Doc said, Chhavi...You need to chill! So I'm chilling #preppingforsurgery." In an earlier post, the actress wrote, "Early detection is the only key and it's worth every effort."

358.title: SDMC to launch month-long anti-encroachment drive
358.article_body: The BJP-ruled South Delhi Municipal Corporation will launch a month-long anti-encroachment drive at several places, civic authorities said on Monday. "Encroachers will not be spared," said SDMC Mayor Mukesh Suryan, adding that before the anti-encroachment drive is launched, notices will be sent to those who have encroached upon public land, roads and footpaths.

359.title: Pune Police seize cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh
359.article_body: The Pune Police crime branch has recovered a cache of 11 illegal weapons worth ₹3.35 lakh and 14 live rounds from four people including one dealer. The first arrest was made after the officials of unit 6 learned about a possible weapon sale in Wagholi. The accused shared information about the people who bought weapons from him in police custody.

360.title: Free booster COVID vaccine shots for all aged above 18 at Haryana govt centres
360.article_body: The Haryana government on Monday announced that it will provide free booster COVID-19 vaccine doses to the eligible population aged above 18 at government vaccination centres. This will cost the state government ₹300 crore, the Haryana Directorate of Information said. The state has about 1.2 crore beneficiaries in the 18 to 59 years age group, it added.

361.title: Japan sends envoy to Solomon Islands over China security pact worry
361.article_body: Japan sent its Vice Foreign Minister Kentaro Uesugi for a three-day trip to Solomon Islands on Monday amid concerns over latter's security pact with China. Uesugi's trip comes after US sent a delegation to Solomon Islands and warned of action if a permanent Chinese military presence is set up there. Australia and New Zealand have also voiced concerns over pact.

362.title: Ishan Kishan had a miserable time batting against LSG: Sunil Gavaskar
362.article_body: Ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar said MI's Ishan Kishan had a "miserable time" batting against LSG on Monday. "Ishan just walked off [after his dismissal]...he just wanted to get out of his misery," he stated. Ishan was dismissed on the bowling of Ravi Bishnoi after the ball bounced off LSG wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock's shoe and Jason Holder took the catch.

363.title: Gadkari announces Pune-Aurangabad expressway, to reduce travel time to 1.15 hrs
363.article_body: An access-controlled expressway will be constructed between Aurangabad and Pune at a cost of ₹10,000 crore, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari announced. This will reduce the travel time between the two cities to 1.15 hours. There will be no turns and the vehicles could move at a speed of up to 140 km per hour.

364.title: Cong to constitute 'empowered action group 2024' for Lok Sabha polls
364.article_body: Congress will constitute an 'empowered action group 2024' to address political challenges ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, party leader Randeep Surjewala announced on Monday. The decision was taken after a meeting on poll strategist Prashant Kishor's proposal to revamp the party. Notably, this also comes amid speculations of Kishor joining Congress, although no formal announcement has been made yet.

365.title: Water supply to be hit for 12 hours in Kalyan, Dombivli tomorrow
365.article_body: Kalyan and Dombivli areas in Maharashtra's Thane district will face a 12-hour water cut from 8 am on Tuesday. The water cut has been announced in order to undertake the repairs and restoration work in Barave, Mohili, Netivali and Titwala water treatment plant. Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) officials urged residents to use water sparingly during the next few days.

366.title: Govt blocks 16 YouTube news channels for 'spreading disinformation'
366.article_body: The government on Monday said it has blocked 16 YouTube news channels "for spreading disinformation related to India's national security, foreign relations and public order". Six of the blocked channels are Pakistan-based and 10 are based in India, the government has said. The channels "were spreading false...information to...incite communal disharmony and disturb public order", it said.

367.title: Lawyers 'manhandle' policemen outside Delhi court post assault on colleague
367.article_body: Two policemen were allegedly pushed and manhandled by lawyers outside the Karkardooma Courts Complex on Monday, who were protesting against the alleged assault on a colleague by a sub-inspector on Sunday. "Two police officers on Sunday misbehaved with lawyer Neeraj Jha, who went to the Nand Nagari police station to meet his client," said Shahdara Bar Association president VK Singh.

368.title: CBSE is Central Board of Suppressing Education: Rahul Gandhi
368.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday termed the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) as the 'Central Board of Suppressing Education'. This comes a few days after CBSE removed several chapters from the history and political science syllabus of classes 10 and 12. He also termed the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh as the 'Rashtriya Shiksha Shredder' for modification of the syllabus.

369.title: Israel embassy unveils street-art in Delhi, honours Indo-Jewish actors
369.article_body: The Israeli embassy on Monday unveiled a street-art mural in New Delhi's Connaught Place to mark 30 years of bilateral relations. The mural, inaugurated by Israeli Ambassador Naor Gilon and Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi, highlights contributions of Indian-Jewish actors Nadira, Sulochana and Pramila. The mural was designed by Delhi Street Art Founder Yogesh Saini and team.

370.title: Father throws his 2 children in well in Jaunpur, both found dead
370.article_body: A man had allegedly thrown his two young children in a well in Naipoora village of the Jaunpur district in Uttar Pradesh. The bodies have been brought out of the well and have been sent for post-mortem, police said. Notably, the accused, Irfan's mental condition was not well since he returned from Saudi Arabia five years ago, police said.

371.title: Vijay Varma recreates Kareena's 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' dialogue
371.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma on Monday shared a video on Instagram recreating Actress Kareena Kapoor's viral dialogue from 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. He wrote, "The only Gag I ever wanted to play with Kareena, the only and ultimate Poo." Kareena also joins him making funny faces. They shot the video on the sets of 'The Devotion of Suspect X'.

372.title: Pleased with the way we competed: Lampard after Everton's loss to Liverpool
372.article_body: Despite Everton slipping into the EPL's relegation zone after a 2-0 defeat against Liverpool on Sunday, manager Frank Lampard has said that he is "pleased with the way" Everton competed. "In terms of performance, I am more positive...There are 18 points to fight for...It is important for the players...not to get...into that in a negative way," Lampard said.

373.title: Thane woman loses ₹71.15 lakh to man who promised her a crematorium tender
373.article_body: A 54-year-old woman from Maharashtra's Thane was cheated of ₹71.15 lakh by a man who promised her a tender for maintenance of a crematorium in Navi Mumbai. The woman has a water supply business and she had met the accused in 2017. The 28-year-old accused has been booked but he is yet to be arrested.

374.title: Thieves use bulldozer to dig out ATM machine in Maha, CCTV video goes viral
374.article_body: A now-viral video has shown thieves digging out an ATM machine using an excavator in the Miraj area of Maharashtra's Sangli. The incident took place on Saturday (April 23) at a booth of an Axis bank ATM carrying ₹27 lakh cash. The video shows the stolen bulldozer smashing the booth's glass door, digging the ATM out and dragging it.

375.title: 95% patients visiting Delhi mohalla clinics happy with services: CM
375.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said 95% of the patients visiting 'Aam Aadmi Mohalla' clinics in the national capital are satisfied with the services provided there. "We have opened two mohalla clinics in Delhi's most posh area, Greater Kailash, and a lot of rich patients also come to these centres," Kejriwal told Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann.

376.title: Twitter in final stages of negotiation for its sale to Elon Musk: Report
376.article_body: Twitter is in the final stretch of negotiations with the world's richest person, Elon Musk, about a potential sale of the microblogging site, Bloomberg reported on Monday. "Twitter could reach an agreement as soon as Monday," Bloomberg added, without specifying the date. A few days ago, Musk had said that he had secured $46.5 billion in funding to buy Twitter.

377.title: Over 1,000 people fined for not wearing face masks in Noida: Police
377.article_body: Over a thousand people were penalised across Noida and Greater Noida in a day after they were allegedly found without face masks in public places amid a rise in COVID-19 cases, police said on Monday. After a rise in the number of positive cases in Gautam Buddh Nagar, the UP government made wearing face masks mandatory in public places.

378.title: Jared Padalecki 'lucky' to survive 'bad car accident': Jensen Ackles
378.article_body: Actor Jensen Ackles has stated that his 'Supernatural' Jared Padalecki couldn't join a fan convention in New Jersey he was attending as the latter was in "a very bad car accident". Jensen further said that Jared is "lucky to be alive" thanks to the airbags. "He wasn't driving. He was in the passenger seat...Really, really bad car accident," Jensen added.

379.title: Twitter executives met Musk to discuss $43 bn takeover bid: Reports
379.article_body: Twitter executives met the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday to discuss his $43 billion takeover offer, reports said. The development comes after Musk revealed that he has secured $46.5 billion in funding to take the social media company private. Musk has been meeting with Twitter shareholders recently to seek support for his bid, Reuters reported.

380.title: Not satisfied with Police's status report on security at Delhi CM's home: HC
380.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday said it was not satisfied with the status report filed by the Delhi Police regarding security arrangement outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence, which was vandalised by a group of protesters. "You'd put up barricades...received intimation about the protest. But, what kind of 'bandobast' (arrangement) did you put in place," the court asked the police.

381.title: Those two are the best in history: Rublev on Nadal and Djokovic
381.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the GOAT (Greatest of All Time) debate, world number eight Andrey Rublev said both Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic "are the best in history". He added, "Now they are fighting for one of them to somehow prevail and be alone on that throne." Nadal is a 21-time Grand Slam champion, while Djokovic has won 20 Slams.

382.title: Power comes and goes, some are anxious after losing Maha polls: Pawar
382.article_body: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar commented on the BJP by saying that some people are "anxious" after losing the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly polls in 2019. "Power comes and goes...Some people are getting anxious...because before the state election, claims were made of coming again to power but it did not happen and hence they are anxious," Pawar said.

383.title: BJP forms 'weak booth committee' team ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls
383.article_body: BJP has constituted 'weak booth committee' team in a bid to make party stronger ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, party leader Dilip Ghosh said on Monday. "There are four members per committee spread across [India]. The purpose of [this] is to expand BJP's presence wherever it's weak," Ghosh added. BJP's Baijayant Jay Panda also chaired meeting in this regard.

384.title: No target is too big for Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game: Hogg
384.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said no target is too big for MS Dhoni when it comes to finishing the game. "Whether it's 15 runs...or 30 runs an over, Dhoni...believes that he can get his team over the line," Hogg stated. On Thursday, Dhoni scored 16 runs in the last four balls of the final over to help CSK beat MI.

385.title: Liverpool back within 1 point of Man City after derby win vs Everton in PL
385.article_body: Liverpool moved back within one point of leaders Manchester City in the Premier League standings after a 2-0 win against Everton in the Merseyside derby on Sunday. Andy Robertson and Divock Origi scored for Liverpool in 62nd and 85th minute respectively. Meanwhile, Christian Pulisic netted a 90th-minute winner to help Chelsea beat 10-man West Ham United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.

386.title: Mandhana engages in verbal fight with Rajasathan players after 'mankad' run-out
386.article_body: During a Senior Women's T20 League match against Rajasthan, Maharashtra opener Smriti Mandhana got involved in a verbal fight with the opposition players after being dismissed to a 'mankad' run-out. Mandhana was seen exchanging words with Rajasthan players while the decision was being referred to the third umpire. Mandhana got out for 28(30).

387.title: Will not tolerate invasion: Taliban on alleged Pakistan airstrikes on Afghanistan
387.article_body: Afghanistan's acting Defence Minister Mullah Mohammad Yaqoob has said Taliban would not tolerate "invasions" from its neighbours after Taliban administration blamed Pakistan for airstrikes that officials said killed dozens in Kunar and Khost provinces. Yaqoob said, "We have tolerated that attack...next time we might not tolerate it." Pakistan said the two countries are "brotherly countries".

388.title: Banks ask NPCI to clarify stance on UPI for crypto trading: Report
388.article_body: Several banks have asked the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) to issue a formal directive over restrictions regarding the use of United Payments Interface (UPI) to purchase and sell virtual digital assets, the Economic Times reported. Some banks have blocked UPI for crypto trading following "verbal instructions" from NPCI, the report said, adding a circular from NPCI is unlikely.

389.title: Had 15-min role, no idea how director changed it to 40 mins: Charan on Acharya
389.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said initially he had a 15-minute role in the movie 'Acharya'. "Pooja Hegde and I were just supposed to make cameo appearances. I've no idea how Siva developed it into a 40-minute role," he added. "Here, I'd like to thank director SS Rajamouli for allowing me to shoot for 'Acharya' amidst the filming of RRR," Charan said.

390.title: Dhoni's shoes can't be filled, but Jadeja definitely has it in him: Rayudu
390.article_body: CSK batter Ambati Rayudu has said that their captain Ravindra Jadeja has the leadership qualities in him not only to lead CSK but also Team India in the future. "Filling in MS Dhoni's shoes, it's never going to happen. But Jadeja definitely has it in him and under the guidance of Mahi bhai (Dhoni)...Jadeja will become better," he stated.

391.title: Rise in policy rates not anti-national activity: Raghuram Rajan
391.article_body: Politicians and bureaucrats need to understand that rise in policy rates isn't some anti-national activity benefiting foreign investors, ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan wrote on LinkedIn. He added, "Inflation's up in India...At some point, the RBI will have to raise rates, like the rest of the world." His remarks came as India's retail inflation reached a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March.

392.title: Mevani re-arrested in new case after getting bail in case over tweets on PM
392.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was re-arrested in a new case just after he was granted bail on Monday by a court in Assam in case over tweets on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Mevani had been taken back to the Kokrajhar Jail after the hearing. His counsel had earlier said that he had been granted bail and formalities were being completed.

393.title: Modern Love Mumbai starring Fatima, Arshad & Pratik Gandhi to release in May
393.article_body: Modern Love Mumbai starring actors Fatima Sana Shaikh, Arshad Warsi and Pratik Gandhi will release on May 13. The Mumbai chapter of the US original anthology series Modern Love, helmed by John Carney, has brought together six filmmakers Vishal Bhardwaj, Hansal Mehta, Shonali Bose, Dhruv Sehgal, Alankrita Shrivastava and Nupur Asthana. It will feature stories about discovering love.

394.title: Karan to return with 'Koffee with...'; new season goes on floors in May: Reports
394.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar and his team are reportedly gearing up to start shooting for the new season of 'Koffee with Karan'. According to reports, the planning and pre-production have already begun and the team is now ready to start shooting from mid-May. The show is expected to go on air in the month of June on Star Network, reports added.

395.title: BJP leader Tarachand Chheda dies aged 71 due to post-COVID-19 complications
395.article_body: Former minister and BJP leader Tarachand Chheda passed away aged 71 at his home in the Bhuj town of Gujarat's Kutch. Chheda had been suffering from post-COVID-19 complications after contracting the infection in January this year. "The viral disease left his lungs damaged which led to pneumonia and he could not recover from that," Chheda's younger son said.

396.title: Future Group shares fall up to 20% after Reliance cancels deal
396.article_body: Shares of Future Group companies plummeted on Monday, with Future Lifestyle Fashions and Future Supply Chain Solutions each trading 20% lower. Meanwhile, Future Retail stock dropped 5% to ₹27.80 per share.This comes after Reliance Industries called off its ₹24,713-crore deal to acquire Future Group's assets after secured creditors of the latter voted against the proposal.

397.title: 'KGF Chapter 2' becomes 6th highest-grossing Indian movie, earns ₹883 cr globally
397.article_body: Kannada film 'KGF Chapter 2' earnings jumped on Sunday, taking its total worldwide earnings to ₹883 crore, according to film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. The Yash-starrer film is now the sixth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, according to the film trade analyst. It overtook Aamir Khan's blockbuster PK's lifetime gross earnings of ₹854 crore, The Hindustan Times reported.

398.title: Heatwave predicted in 12 states & 1 UT in the next 5 days, list released
398.article_body: IMD has predicted heatwave conditions over the next five days in isolated pockets of Gujarat and Odisha. Heatwave is likely in north coastal Andhra Pradesh and sub-Himalayan West Bengal during April 25-27, in west Rajasthan and mid-Maharashtra during April 26-29 and in Bihar, Jharkhand during April 25-28. Punjab, south Haryana-Delhi, south UP, MP to face a heatwave during April 27-29.

399.title: AI helps Pune graduates prepare for interviews, apply for jobs
399.article_body: Over 3,000 students in less than 15 days have used Savitribai Phule Pune University's AI-assisted digital smart interview platform to prepare for upcoming interviews. "The industry has its requirements ready and they have the job openings as well, the AI is helping to identify which candidates can fit in and where," said Dr Nitin Karmalkar, Vice-Chancellor, SPPU.

400.title: RGV praises Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona', calls it 'marvellous'
400.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise actor Kichcha Sudeepa's upcoming movie 'Vikrant Rona', writing, "Had...good fortune to see some 3D footage of 'Vikrant Rona'...And I must say it's looking next level. Absolutely marvellous." "Can't wait to see full film on July 28," he added. It will release in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam.
